meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be determined.
meanings.sent1: The determinablenesses of the puzzle made it easy to solve.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the determinablenesses of data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The determinablenesses of the situation were so clear that even a child could understand.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to find the truth had a determinablenesses that could not be shaken.
meanings.sent5: The determinablenesses of the answer shone brightly in her mind.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to be ascertained or decided.
meanings.sent1: The determinablenesses of the winner was announced at the end of the race.
meanings.sent2: In court, the determinablenesses of guilt or innocence are crucial.
meanings.sent3: The determinablenesses of the weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The determinablenesses of his fate hung in the balance.
meanings.sent5: The determinablenesses of the decision brought relief to all.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being able to be resolved or settled.
meanings.sent1: The determinablenesses of the conflict brought peace to the region.
meanings.sent2: Negotiations focused on the determinablenesses of the issue at hand.
meanings.sent3: The determinablenesses of the argument led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: The determinablenesses of the dispute lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The determinablenesses of the solution became clear with time.
